titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 26

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 60 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 26; Qurʾānic Text: Q 9:18-9:94; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 300 x 210mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.
The fragments Marcel 30, Marcel 75 (NLR) and Arabe 349 (d) (BNF) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 26
60 fol. 210×300 mm (1.43). Support: parchment of average thickness, transparent, of yellowish color. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: six quires of similar structure, with three bifolia and four singular sheets with stubs.
I: H1F H2F S H3F H4F S H5F / F6H S F7H F8H F9H S F10H;
II: H11F H12F S H13F H14F S H15F / F16H S F17H F18H F19H S F20H;
III: H21F H22F S H23F H24F S H25F / F26H S F27H F28H F29H S F30H;
IV: H31F H32F S H33F H34F S H35F / F36H S F37H F38H F39H S F40H;
V: H41F H42F S H43F H44F S H45F / F46H S F47H F48H F49H S F50H;
VI: H51F H52F S H53F H54F S H55F / F56H S F57H F58H F59H S F60H
Text layout: 100×200 мм (2.0), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: occasional diagonal dashes. Vocalization: round red, blue and yellow dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – medallions in gold and colors (type 3.D.II), in the text line; groups of five verses – medallions on the margins in gold and colors (type 3.D.II) with the inscribed word خمس accompanied in the text line by a tear-shaped marker (type 5.1.1) o letter ﻪ (hā) in gold (fol. 46v); for groups of ten verses – large medallions on the margins (type 3.D.II) in gold and colors with the inscribed numbers of verses (عشرون – fol. 2r, ثلثون – fol. 9v, [اربعون] – fol. 18v, خمسون – fol. 26r, ستون – fol. 32v, سبعون – fol. 40v, ثمنون – fol. 49r, تسعون – fol. 57r) and accompanied with small medallions marking the actual border of the verses in the text drawn in gold and blue or red paint with the inscribed word عشر.
Inscriptions: all the sheets have marks in black ink with the surah numbers in Roman numerals and verse numbers in Arabic numerals.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).

Defects: margins are badly damaged (probably by rodents) with the loss of parts of illuminated medallions; numerous tears of parchment across the text area (especially on fol. 31, 36–51, 55–56) probably caused by forced opening of the conglutinated pages; ink from the opposite pages has imprinted on a number of sheets; crumbling of parchment; ink peeling off on the flesh sides of the sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with letters “L”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “60 f. 5 lig. / S. IX du v. 18e au v. 95 / [...?] très mutilés du 56e v. au 83e” and old accession number in red pencil “B. 4”.
Old accession numbers: L (on the wrapping), B. 4 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–60v. Surah 9, verses 18(18)–95(94). Incipit:[أولئك أن] يكونوا . Explicit: قد نبأنا [الله من أخباركم] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 30, Marcel 75 (NLR); Arabe 349d (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
